title: Play a nice sweet song
description: Did you know the oldest surviving guitar-like instrument is actually around 3,500 years old? It is a 3-string instrument with a plectrum suspended from the neck, it was owned by an Egyptian singer called Har-Mose and was buried alongside him - You can still see the instrument on display at the Archaeological Museum in Cairo, Egypt.
completion_text: What good is a guitar if we don't have a campfire to sing songs around? Try drawing a nice big campfire with some marshmallows for toasting! Maybe a big moon on the horizon too? Be wild, be creative!

steps.hint: It's a very nice night! Définis l'arrière-plan color to darkblue - **tape** `background darkblue`
Définis the `stroke` to `0` in a new line.
Définis your guitar `color` to `lightbrown`.
Déplace-toi the cursor to place the guitar - **tape** `moveTo 120, 250`
Dessine the first part of the body with une ellipse - **tape** `ellipse 60, 65`
Now for the second part of the body, `move` the cursor `70` pixels vers la droite.
Dessine a `circle` of size `55` for the second part of the guitar.
Every guitar needs a neck, move the cursor to place it - **tape** `move 20, -10`
Définis the neck `color` to `brown`.
Dessine the neck of the guitar with a rectangle - **tape** `rectangle 150, 20`
Now place the headstock - **tape** `move 150, -5`
Dessine the headstock with a `rectangle` of size `40` by `30`.
Time to place the soundhole in the body - **tape** `move -170, 15`
Définis the outline of the soundhole with a `stroke` of `brown` color and size `10`.
Définis the soundhole `color` to `black`.
Dessine the hole with a `circle` of size `20`.
The bridge is the piece that fixes the strings to the body. Let's place it  - **tape** `move -50, -15`
Définis the outline of the bridge with a `stroke` of `red` color and size `10`.
Dessine the bridge with a `rectangle` of size `2` by `35`.
That's a good looking guitar. Time for the strings - **tape** `move 0, 9`
Définis the properties of the strings with a `stroke` of `white` color and size `1`.
Let's draw the 4 strings with a loop - **tape** `for i in [ 1 .. 4 ]`
Dessine a string using a line - **tape** `line 250`
And move the cursor slightly down to place the next ones - **tape** `move 0, 4`
Press **Enter** and **Backspace** to set the `color` to `white` outside the loop
You are ready to play music! Start a new loop - **tape** `for i in [ 1 .. 10 ]`
Select a random location - **tape** `moveTo (random 200, 400), (random 100, 400)`
Come on, play some notes! - **copy and paste** `text '♪'`
